ReferenceType.Description: Used to indicate that source and target Node have a topological connection.
Defines the parent (i.e. the communication Device) of a Network.
Used to bind the offline representation of a Device to the online representation.

Object.Description: Contains all instances of communication networks
Starting point of the configured device topology.

Property.Description: Hint of whether the Server is currently able to communicate to Devices in the topology.

ObjectType.Description: Defines the basic information components for all configurable elements in a device topology

Variable.Description: A parameter which belongs to the topology element.

Object.Description: An application specific functional group used to organize parameters and methods.
Used to organize parameters for identification of this TopologyElement
Used to lock the topology element.

ObjectType.Description: Defines the basic information components for all configurable elements in a device topology

Property.Description: Identifier that uniquely identifies, within a manufacturer, a device instance
An incremental counter indicating the number of times the static data within the Device has been modified
Name of the company that manufactured the device
Address (pathname in the file system or a URL | Web address) of user manual for the device
Overall revision level of the device
Revision level of the software/firmware of the device
Revision level of the hardware of the device

Variable.Description: A protocol-specific file for the device.

Object.Description: Organizes images that are used within UIElements.

ObjectType.Description: Adds the concept of Blocks needed for block-oriented FieldDevices

Property.Description: Incremental counter indicating the number of times the static data within the Block has been modified
Current mode of operation the Block is able to achieve
Modes of operation that are allowed for the Block based on application requirements
Mode the Block should be set to during normal operating conditions
Mode of operation that is desired for the Block

ObjectType.Description: Defines a general pattern to expose and configure modular components

Object.Description: Folder maintaining the set of (sub-types of) BaseObjectTypes that can be instantiated in the ConfigurableComponent

ObjectType.Description: FolderType is used to organize the Parameters and Methods from the complete set (ParameterSet, MethodSet) with regard to their application

Object.Description: An application specific functional group used to organize parameters and methods.

Variable.Description: A user interface element assigned to this group.

ObjectType.Description: General structure of a Protocol ObjectType

Field.Name: FAILURE
Field.Description: Malfunction of the device or any of its peripherals.

Field.Name: OFF_SPEC
Field.Description: The device is currently working outside of its specified range or that internal diagnoses indicate deviations from measured or set values.

Field.Name: MAINTENANCE_REQUIRED
Field.Description: This element is working, but a maintenance operation is required.

VariableType.Description: The base type for all UI Element Types.

ObjectType.Description: Represents the communication means for Devices that are connected to it.

Object.Description: The ConnectionPoint(s) that have been configured for this Network.

ObjectType.Description: Represents the interface (interface card) of a Device to a Network.

Object.Description: The address of the device on this network.

Property.Description: Server-specific period of time in milliseconds until the Server will revoke a lock.

Field.Name: Current
Field.Description: The currently used version of the software identified by the CurrentVersion Object.

Field.Name: Pending
Field.Description: The pending version of the software that could be installed identified by the PendingVersion Object.

Field.Name: Fallback
Field.Description: The fallback version of the software identified by the FallbackVersion Object.

Field.Name: KeepsParameters
Field.Description: If KeepsParameters is not set, the device will lose its configuration during update. The Client should do a backup of the parameters before the update and restore them afterwards.

Field.Name: WillDisconnect
Field.Description: If WillDisconnect is set, the OPC UA Server will restart during installation. This can be the case if the update is about the firmware of the device that hosts the OPC UA Server.

Field.Name: RequiresPowerCycle
Field.Description: If RequiresPowerCycle is set, the devices require a manual power off / power on for installation.

Field.Name: WillReboot
Field.Description: If WillReboot is set, the device will reboot during the update, inclusive of embedded infrastructure elements like an integrated switch. An update Client should take this into account since the devices behind an integrated switch are not reachable for that time.

Field.Name: NeedsPreparation
Field.Description: If NeedsPreparation is not set, the Client can install the update without maintaining the PrepareForUpdateStateMachine. This can be used to support an installation without stopping the software.
